title: FIA foils fake travel bid; passenger offloaded at Islamabad Airport
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 09 (APP): The Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) Immigration Wing at Islamabad International Airport foiled a bid to travel abroad using forged immigration stamps and offloaded a passenger attempting to fly to Malaysia.

An FIA official told APP on Sunday that the accused, identified as Nabeel Akhtar, a resident of Rawalpindi, was intercepted while attempting to board Flight PK-894 bound for Malaysia.

During scrutiny, FIA officers discovered fake arrival and departure stamps on the passengerâ€™s passport. Upon verification, no corresponding record was found in the official immigration system.

The suspect was immediately taken into custody and handed over to the Anti-Human Trafficking Circle, Islamabad for further legal proceedings.

According to the FIA spokesperson, the agency is maintaining strict vigilance at all entry and exit points to curb human smuggling and illegal travel attempts.
